chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Oscar Rodriguez Jr. was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs are paid in full.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit. Court grants work release to include authorization for installation of the IID.

records.addlTxt: 1:45 pm case called. Defendant Oscar  Rodriguez in court with attorney Max Wayne Saylor.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint addressed-confirmed receipt reading waived. Preliminary hearing addressed. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the criminal complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Saylor confirms receipt, waives further reading-defendant wished to enter a No Contest plea.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and DRI Count 3.  Statement by defendant. Statement by Attorney Saylor. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 5 years Wisconsin State Prison, to be served as 30 months Initial Confinement and 30 months Extended Supervision -STAYED- and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 11 months and 6 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day served. Work release includes authorization for installation for the IID. To be served forthwith. Defendant to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD program. AODA and follow through,   maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Terms of Agent, $3000 fine inclusive of costs, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan, bond to be applied. 36 mo DL revocation, 36 mo IID to be effective today, OWI Assessment. If revoked, defendant is eligible for CIP/is eligible for SAP.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-17-2015 01:45 pm
State's
Status conference at 03-31-2015 09:15 am

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Oscar Rodriguez in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have an attorney - does not qualify for SPD services. The court will proceed with the understanding that the defendant will privately retain an attorney. ADA Anderson requesting $3000 Cash Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $3000 Cash Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
